com.poc.designpatterns.builderpattern

Class Validation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poc.designpatterns.builderpattern.Validation

  • public class Validation
extends java.lang.Object
    Validation class used for validation. The class is an implementation of the famous Builder Pattern. In order to validate a param with a certain value. Example-
    Validation.checkThat(someString).as(paramName).is(Validation.isNotNull()).add(Validation.isNotEmpty());
    This code validates if the string someString is not null and is not empty(of lenght zero).
    Author:
    73ddy

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Validation.Builder
      Builder class for Validation
      static class  Validation.Constraint
      Each validation returns a Constraint.

    • Method Detail

      • isNotNull

        public static Validator isNotNull()
        Throws IllegalArgumentException if anything other than not null String, Collection or Array is passed. Throws IllegalStateException if -
        • 1. The value passed is string and is empty.
        • 2. The value passed is collection and is empty.
        • 3. The value passed is an array and either the array is of length zero or every object of array is null.
        Returns:
        not null validator

      • isNotEmpty

        public static Validator isNotEmpty()
        Returns a not empty Validator
        Returns:
        NOT NULL VALIDATOR

      • checkThat

        public static Validation.Builder checkThat(java.lang.Object value)
        Creates a new builder for the given value.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        Validation.Builder
